body_html: @hughsando, these are in fact the debates we had internally. Ideally in the future we'd be able to ship all compiled versions and choose at runtime, but logistically that's actually quite time consuming and tricky to implement. We are looking into it, but this was the best solution we had for now. We wanted people to know that if they have that warning, things are working, but it could be faster if you build it yourself. I.e. if you benchmarking our system, it's not a valid benchmark w/o compiling it with the best optimizations.

body: @hughsando, these are in fact the debates we had internally. Ideally in the future we'd be able to ship all compiled versions and choose at runtime, but logistically that's actually quite time consuming and tricky to implement. We are looking into it, but this was the best solution we had for now. We wanted people to know that if they have that warning, things are working, but it could be faster if you build it yourself. I.e. if you benchmarking our system, it's not a valid benchmark w/o compiling it with the best optimizations.
